A **robe of weakness** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is made of [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather"), and has the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of a "colored robe" when unidentified.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Hack'EM info"*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

[Aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"), [high priests](/wiki/High_priest "High priest"), the [Arch Priest](/wiki/Arch_Priest "Arch Priest"), and [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [priests](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)") may [be generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a robe of weakness.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, a robe of weakness grants 1 base AC and sets the character's base [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") to 3, unless they are also wearing [gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power").

## Strategy

A robe of weakness is generally undesirable to discover and makes identifying robes by wearing them perilous, especially without knowing their [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"): robes of weakness are frequently generated cursed. It still has some limited niche uses, however, such as making strength [exercise](/wiki/Exercise "Exercise") more effective. Informally identifying one tends to be non-trivial, since they share the same base cost as the [robe of power](/wiki/Robe_of_power "Robe of power") and [robe of protection](/wiki/Robe_of_protection "Robe of protection").

## Encyclopedia entry

Robes are the only garments, apart from Shirts, ever to have sleeves. They have three uses:  
1\. As the official uniform of Priests, Priestesses, Monks, Nuns (see Nunnery), and Wizards. The OMT \[ Official Management Term ] prescribed for the Robes of Priests and Nuns is that they \_fall in severe folds\_; of Priestesses that they \_float\_; and of Wizards that they \_swirl\_. You can thus see who you are dealing with.  
2\. For Kings. The OMT here is \_falling in stately folds\_.  
3\. As the garb of Desert Nomads. \[...]

\[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]
